text:
TITLE:
   .H/O tracheal reconstruction (Tracheobronchial)
   Assessment:
          Pt with head flexed forward as remains with stitches from
   chin to chest. Arms elevated on pillows and sitting up right. JP drain
   on left side of neck intact with scant serosang drainage. Pt
   experiencing extreme thirst which causes pt anxiety at times.
          Oxygen saturation remains >97% while on 4L NC and face mask
   at 35% FiO2.
          Lungs rhonchorous and diminished in bases. Occasionally
   insp/exp wheezes noted.
   Action:
          Monitoring respiratory effort. Pt given Albuterol and
   Mucomyst nebulizer treatments.
          ABG obtained which continues to reveal metabolic acidosis.
          Haldol given for anxiety and provided pt with emotional
   support. Swabs provided for mouth moisture.
          Using IS and encouraging pt to C/DB. Chest PT with
   turns/repositions every 2-3 hours for back care.
   Response:
          Wheezing has decreased and pt denies any SOB. Oxygen
   saturations remain >96%. Remains diminished in bases.
          Pt taking short naps. Anxiety improved.
          Pt pulling 650-1000mL with IS. Coughing up small amounts of
   thick yellow/tan secretions. Using yankeur appropriately.
   Plan:
          Continue to monitor respiratory status and treating with
   nebs as needed. Follow ABGs for worsening acidosis.
          ? bronch today followed by speech and swallow evaluation.
          Provide emotional support to pt.
          Continue to turn/reposition every 2-3 hours for back relief
   and for CPT. Encourage IS and C/DB.
   Oliguria/Anuria
   Assessment:
          Patient admitted with baseline renal insufficiency.
          Creatinine 2.0. Bicarb 20. ABG revealing metabolic acidosis
   with pH 7.23
          Urine output dropped to 10cc/hr overnight.
          IVF of NS infusing at 100cc/hr.
   Action:
          Dr. [**First Name (STitle) 7018**] notified of low urine output.
          Repeat Creatinine and Bicarb obtained.
          Pt given albumin for low urine output and 1 Amp Bicarb.
   Response:
          Urine output increased to 35cc/hr x1 hr then started to
   taper back down to approx 20-25cc/hr.
          Creatinine 2.3 and Bicarb 13. pH remains unchanged >> Dr
   [**First Name (STitle) 7018**] notified.
   Plan:
          Continue to monitor output and labs.
   . H/O pain control (acute pain, chronic pain)
   Assessment:
          Pt with mild incisional pain.
   Action:
          Using Dilaudid PCA as needed.
   Response:
          Pt remains with little to no pain.
   Plan:
          Continue to monitor pain/comfort.
